elements.title: meadow death camas (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the nectar and pollen of the meadow death camas and its relatives are so toxic that no bee except the death camas miner bee (pictured on flower) can eat them?

elements.title: Dadang Supriatna (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that according to Dadang Supriatna, his father gave him 1,000 bricks to fund his studies?

elements.title: global dimming (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that sulfate pollution causes cooling through global dimming, which is comparable to warming from methane?

elements.title: Josef Peskoller (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that a priest refused to perform the wedding ceremony for Austrian socialist Josef Peskoller and his fiancée Maria Griel on political grounds in 1928?

elements.title: data breaches (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that data breaches are rarely detected by the compromised organization?

elements.title: Classy 101 (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Puerto Rican singer Young Miko composed "Classy 101" in Los Angeles and had never met Colombian singer Feid before he recorded the song with her?

elements.title: Fang Gan (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Fang Gan failed the imperial examination more than ten times, apparently because of his cleft lip?

elements.title: phase of ice (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that ice in outer space is an amorphous solid, and this may be the most common phase of ice in the universe?

elements.title: Butt Drugs (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Butt Drugs in Corydon, Indiana, had Butt Liquors and free parking in the rear?
